original_title: Sri Lanka’s Colombo Port capacity will rise to 15mn boxes in 3 years: Minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka plans to expand the Colombo port and increase its capacity to 15 million containers a year in the next three years with the completion of two terminals under construction, Ports Minister Nimal Siripala de Silva said.
“Currently the capacity of the Colombo Port is 8.5 million containers, and we expect it to increase up to 15 million,” Minister Siripala said in Parliament.
“Eastern Terminal will be developed using our own money, Jaya Terminal is also being developed and Adani is working with Sri Lanka for the Colombo West terminal.”
We plan to increase the capacity in the two to three years,” De Silva said.
“The long term plan is the development of the North Port and we plan to establish 4 or 5 more terminals,” Minister de Silva said.
“We did the feasibility with funds from the Asian Development Bank.”
Related: Sri Lanka Colombo plans for 35mn TEU capacity with North Port
The North Port is expected to bring Colombo’s capacity to 35 million TEUs.(Colombo/June 06/2023)
